verses.kjv: In the five and twentieth year of our captivity, in the beginning of the year, in the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after that the city was smitten, in the selfsame day the hand of the LORD was upon me, and brought me thither.
verses.ct: In the 25th year of our exile, at the start of the year, on the 10th day of the month — which was the 14th year after the city had been destroyed — on that very day the power of the LORD came over me and brought me there.

verses.kjv: In the visions of God brought he me into the land of Israel, and set me upon a very high mountain, by which was as the frame of a city on the south.
verses.ct: In visions from God, he brought me to the land of Israel and placed me on a very high mountain. On its south side there was something that looked like the framework of a city.

verses.kjv: And he brought me thither, and, behold, there was a man, whose appearance was like the appearance of brass, with a line of flax in his hand, and a measuring reed; and he stood in the gate.
verses.ct: He brought me there, and I saw a man whose appearance was like polished bronze. He held a linen cord and a measuring rod in his hand, and he was standing at the gateway.

verses.kjv: And the man said unto me, Son of man, behold with thine eyes, and hear with thine ears, and set thine heart upon all that I shall shew thee; for to the intent that I might shew them unto thee art thou brought hither: declare all that thou seest to the house of Israel.
verses.ct: The man said to me, "Son of man, look carefully with your eyes, listen closely with your ears, and pay attention to everything I'm about to show you. You were brought here specifically so I could show you these things. Report everything you see to the people of Israel."

verses.kjv: And behold a wall on the outside of the house round about, and in the man’s hand a measuring reed of six cubits long by the cubit and an hand breadth: so he measured the breadth of the building, one reed; and the height, one reed.
verses.ct: I saw a wall surrounding the outside of the temple complex. The measuring rod in the man's hand was about 10 feet long (6 long cubits, each a cubit plus a handbreadth). He measured the wall's thickness — one rod — and its height — one rod.

verses.kjv: Then came he unto the gate which looketh toward the east, and went up the stairs thereof, and measured the threshold of the gate, which was one reed broad; and the other threshold of the gate, which was one reed broad.
verses.ct: Then he went to the gate facing east and climbed its steps. He measured the threshold of the gate — it was one rod deep. The other threshold was also one rod deep.

verses.kjv: And every little chamber was one reed long, and one reed broad; and between the little chambers were five cubits; and the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate within was one reed.
verses.ct: Each guard room was one rod long and one rod wide. The space between the guard rooms was 5 cubits. The threshold of the gate next to the inner porch of the gate was one rod.

verses.kjv: He measured also the porch of the gate within, one reed.
verses.ct: He also measured the inner porch of the gate — it was one rod.

verses.kjv: Then measured he the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and the posts thereof, two cubits; and the porch of the gate was inward.
verses.ct: Then he measured the porch of the gate — 8 cubits, with its side pillars being 2 cubits. The porch of the gate faced inward.

verses.kjv: And the little chambers of the gate eastward were three on this side, and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.
verses.ct: The guard rooms of the east gate had 3 on each side. All 3 on each side were the same size, and the side pillars on each side were also identical in size.

verses.kjv: And he measured the breadth of the entry of the gate, ten cubits; and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
verses.ct: He measured the width of the gate entrance — 10 cubits — and the total length of the gate passage — 13 cubits.

verses.kjv: The space also before the little chambers was one cubit on this side, and the space was one cubit on that side: and the little chambers were six cubits on this side, and six cubits on that side.
verses.ct: There was a barrier wall of one cubit in front of the guard rooms on each side. The guard rooms themselves were 6 cubits on each side.

verses.kjv: He measured then the gate from the roof of one little chamber to the roof of another: the breadth was five and twenty cubits, door against door.
verses.ct: Then he measured the gate from the back wall of one guard room to the back wall of the one across from it — the width was 25 cubits, measured from doorway to doorway.

verses.kjv: He made also posts of threescore cubits, even unto the post of the court round about the gate.
verses.ct: He also measured the side pillars at 60 cubits, extending to the pillar of the courtyard all around the gate.

verses.kjv: And from the face of the gate of the entrance unto the face of the porch of the inner gate were fifty cubits.
verses.ct: From the front of the entrance gate to the front of the inner porch of the gate was 50 cubits.

verses.kjv: And there were narrow windows to the little chambers, and to their posts within the gate round about, and likewise to the arches: and windows were round about inward: and upon each post were palm trees.
verses.ct: There were narrow windows in the guard rooms and in their side pillars throughout the inside of the gate, and also in the archways. Windows went all around the interior, and palm tree designs decorated each side pillar.

verses.kjv: Then brought he me into the outward court, and, lo, there were chambers, and a pavement made for the court round about: thirty chambers were upon the pavement.
verses.ct: Then he brought me into the outer courtyard. I could see rooms and a stone pavement constructed around the courtyard. There were 30 rooms along the pavement.

verses.kjv: And the pavement by the side of the gates over against the length of the gates was the lower pavement.
verses.ct: The pavement ran along the sides of the gates, matching the length of the gates. This was the lower pavement.

verses.kjv: Then he measured the breadth from the forefront of the lower gate unto the forefront of the inner court without, an hundred cubits eastward and northward.
verses.ct: Then he measured the distance from the front of the lower gate to the outside front of the inner courtyard — 100 cubits on both the east and north sides.

verses.kjv: And the gate of the outward court that looked toward the north, he measured the length thereof, and the breadth thereof.
verses.ct: He also measured the length and width of the gate in the outer courtyard that faced north.

verses.kjv: And the little chambers thereof were three on this side and three on that side; and the posts thereof and the arches thereof were after the measure of the first gate: the length thereof was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
verses.ct: Its guard rooms — 3 on each side — its side pillars, and its archways all matched the measurements of the first gate. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.

verses.kjv: And their windows, and their arches, and their palm trees, were after the measure of the gate that looketh toward the east; and they went up unto it by seven steps; and the arches thereof were before them.
verses.ct: Its windows, archways, and palm tree decorations matched the dimensions of the east-facing gate. It was reached by climbing 7 steps, and its archway was on the inner end.

verses.kjv: And the gate of the inner court was over against the gate toward the north, and toward the east; and he measured from gate to gate an hundred cubits.
verses.ct: There was a gate to the inner courtyard directly opposite the north gate, just as there was one opposite the east gate. He measured the distance from gate to gate — 100 cubits.

verses.kjv: After that he brought me toward the south, and behold a gate toward the south: and he measured the posts thereof and the arches thereof according to these measures.
verses.ct: After that, he led me toward the south, and there was a gate facing south. He measured its side pillars and archways — they matched the same dimensions.

verses.kjv: And there were windows in it and in the arches thereof round about, like those windows: the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
verses.ct: It had windows all around it and in its archways, just like the other windows. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.

verses.kjv: And there were seven steps to go up to it, and the arches thereof were before them: and it had palm trees, one on this side, and another on that side, upon the posts thereof.
verses.ct: It was reached by climbing 7 steps, and its archway was on the inner end. It had palm tree designs on its side pillars, one on each side.

verses.kjv: And there was a gate in the inner court toward the south: and he measured from gate to gate toward the south an hundred cubits.
verses.ct: There was also a gate to the inner courtyard on the south side. He measured from this gate to the outer south gate — 100 cubits.

verses.kjv: And he brought me to the inner court by the south gate: and he measured the south gate according to these measures;
verses.ct: Then he brought me into the inner courtyard through the south gate. He measured the south gate, and it matched the same dimensions.

verses.kjv: And the little chambers thereof, and the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, according to these measures: and there were windows in it and in the arches thereof round about: it was fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.
verses.ct: Its guard rooms, side pillars, and archways all matched the same measurements. It had windows in it and in its archways all around. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.

verses.kjv: And the arches round about were five and twenty cubits long, and five cubits broad.
verses.ct: The archways all around were 25 cubits long and 5 cubits deep.

verses.kjv: And the arches thereof were toward the utter court; and palm trees were upon the posts thereof: and the going up to it had eight steps.
verses.ct: Its archway faced the outer courtyard, and palm tree designs decorated its side pillars. Its stairway had 8 steps.

verses.kjv: And he brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he measured the gate according to these measures.
verses.ct: Then he brought me to the east side of the inner courtyard and measured the gate there — it matched the same dimensions.

verses.kjv: And the little chambers thereof, and the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, were according to these measures: and there were windows therein and in the arches thereof round about: it was fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.
verses.ct: Its guard rooms, side pillars, and archways matched the same measurements. It had windows in it and in its archways all around. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.

verses.kjv: And the arches thereof were toward the outward court; and palm trees were upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the going up to it had eight steps.
verses.ct: Its archway faced the outer courtyard, and palm tree designs decorated its side pillars on both sides. Its stairway had 8 steps.

verses.kjv: And he brought me to the north gate, and measured it according to these measures;
verses.ct: Then he brought me to the north gate and measured it — it matched the same dimensions.

verses.kjv: The little chambers thereof, the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, and the windows to it round about: the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
verses.ct: Its guard rooms, side pillars, archways, and windows all around matched the others. It was 50 cubits long and 25 cubits wide.

verses.kjv: And the posts thereof were toward the utter court; and palm trees were upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the going up to it had eight steps.
verses.ct: Its side pillars faced the outer courtyard, and palm tree designs decorated its pillars on both sides. Its stairway had 8 steps.

verses.kjv: And the chambers and the entries thereof were by the posts of the gates, where they washed the burnt offering.
verses.ct: There was a room with its entrance by the side pillars of the gates. This was where they washed the burnt offerings.

verses.kjv: And in the porch of the gate were two tables on this side, and two tables on that side, to slay thereon the burnt offering and the sin offering and the trespass offering.
verses.ct: In the porch of the gate, there were 2 tables on each side — 4 tables total — where the burnt offerings, sin offerings, and guilt offerings were slaughtered.

verses.kjv: And at the side without, as one goeth up to the entry of the north gate, were two tables; and on the other side, which was at the porch of the gate, were two tables.
verses.ct: On the outer side, as you go up to the entrance of the north gate, there were 2 tables, and on the other side of the gate's porch there were 2 more tables.

verses.kjv: Four tables were on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables, whereupon they slew their sacrifices.
verses.ct: So there were 4 tables on one side and 4 tables on the other side of the gate — 8 tables in all — on which the sacrifices were slaughtered.

verses.kjv: And the four tables were of hewn stone for the burnt offering, of a cubit and an half long, and a cubit and an half broad, and one cubit high: whereupon also they laid the instruments wherewith they slew the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
verses.ct: There were also 4 tables of cut stone for the burnt offerings, each 1 and a half cubits long, 1 and a half cubits wide, and one cubit high. On these they placed the tools used to slaughter the burnt offerings and other sacrifices.

verses.kjv: And within were hooks, an hand broad, fastened round about: and upon the tables was the flesh of the offering.
verses.ct: Double-pronged hooks, each a handbreadth long, were attached all around the walls. The meat of the offerings was placed on the tables.

verses.kjv: And without the inner gate were the chambers of the singers in the inner court, which was at the side of the north gate; and their prospect was toward the south: one at the side of the east gate having the prospect toward the north.
verses.ct: Outside the inner gate, in the inner courtyard, there were rooms for the singers. One was beside the north gate and faced south; the other was beside the east gate and faced north.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, This chamber, whose prospect is toward the south, is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house.
verses.ct: He told me, "The room that faces south is for the priests who are responsible for the duties of the temple."

verses.kjv: And the chamber whose prospect is toward the north is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the altar: these are the sons of Zadok among the sons of Levi, which come near to the LORD to minister unto him.
verses.ct: "The room that faces north is for the priests who are responsible for the duties of the altar. These are the descendants of Zadok, the only ones among the descendants of Levi who may approach the LORD to serve him."

verses.kjv: So he measured the court, an hundred cubits long, and an hundred cubits broad, foursquare; and the altar that was before the house.
verses.ct: Then he measured the courtyard — it was a perfect square, 100 cubits long and 100 cubits wide. The altar stood in front of the temple.

verses.kjv: And he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured each post of the porch, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side: and the breadth of the gate was three cubits on this side, and three cubits on that side.
verses.ct: He brought me to the porch of the temple and measured each side pillar of the porch — 5 cubits on each side. The width of the gateway was 3 cubits on each side.

verses.kjv: The length of the porch was twenty cubits, and the breadth eleven cubits; and he brought me by the steps whereby they went up to it: and there were pillars by the posts, one on this side, and another on that side.
verses.ct: The porch was 20 cubits wide and 11 cubits deep. It was reached by a set of steps, and there were columns beside the side pillars, one on each side.
